full_text: For #PublicServiceRecognitionWeek we would like to recognize Oregon’s 36 county election officers who are our front line defenders to protect and advance democracy.  They are all underappreciated heroes. They consistently provide accurate and secure elections with little fanfare. https://t.co/SkePUiGCM0

As of this morning turnout stands at 8.6% with 231,482 ballots returned.  At this point for the January 23rd Special Election turnout was at 17%.  There are 8 days left until ballots must be received.  Make a plan to return yours either through the mail or at a dropbox.
@ORIndependent @reaganknopp This is false.  Voters Pamphlets were delivered to every household in Oregon between April 18 and 20.  Deadline to request Independent ballot or change party was April 24.

@ORobHarris @cazielins Correction.  A notice was sent to every household in the state.  Over 1.8 million Voters Pamphlets with information and a form to be able to request an Independent Party ballot https://t.co/5MKyfCjIwr

There are 10 days left to get your ballot returned.  Make a plan today on how you will return your ballot, whether through the mail or at a dropbox.  Ballots must be received by 8:00pm on the 15th and postmarks do not count.
Voter Registration numbers at the end of April show 2,684,165 registered voters in Oregon  See more detail here: https://t.co/sDOvOMp8nc
Turnout as of this morning is 7.1% with 189,449 ballots returned.  At this point in the 2016 Primary turnout was 10.3% and in the May 2014 Primary 8.3%.
If you have not received your ballot for the May 15th Election please check your status at https://t.co/TdeN4LQU76, and/or contact your county elections office: https://t.co/CzA3Kb8O3w
It's #StarWarsDay .  Use The Force to vote your ballot and get it returned.  Dropboxes are not far, far away.  Find your closest one at https://t.co/TqRRKLtle0
Turnout has doubled to 4.6% this morning, with 124,459 ballots returned.  Wheeler County is still in the lead at 21% turnout.  https://t.co/hZFzRQ4FjF
Turnout is up to 2.3% this morning with 61,485 ballots received.

As of this morning there have been 35,251 ballots returned for a turnout of 1.3%.  Turnout is highest in Wheeler County with 13% turnout.  Turnout numbers will be updated daily at this site: https://t.co/hZFzRQ4FjF

Election Day is two weeks from today.  Ballots are starting to be returned.  Find your nearest dropbox at https://t.co/EO1AMhuVEo.  Ballots must be received by 8:00pm on May 15. https://t.co/i1bCc2aUfv
3,122 people either registered to vote, or updated their registration, online on Tuesday's final day to register for the May 15th election.
@miscmarilyn If you have not received your ballot by May 4th contact your county election office and they can issue you a replacement.

The following counties are participating in a pilot program offering online tracking of your ballot through Ballot Scout​ using USPS Intelligent Mail barcodes: Benton, Clackamas, Clatsop, Hood River, Jackson, Klamath, Lane, Washington, & Yamhill. https://t.co/p6jMtLFyWn https://t.co/AQhVwR3zHt
A Spanish version of the voters pamphlet has been posted on our website: https://t.co/CWQfSSmLEy

Watch your mailbox! Over 2.6 million ballots, one for every registered voter in Oregon, are being mailed and they will begin arriving today and for the next few days.  Ballots must be received by 8pm on May 15th.  You can track your ballot at https://t.co/TdeN4LQU76. https://t.co/lBuaho0uju

Today (April 24) is the voter registration deadline if you want to vote at the May 15th election.  You can register online until 11:59 tonight at https://t.co/tPt2XQ17Ol.  There are just 21 days until election day.  Ballots start being mailed tomorrow. https://t.co/Kpv91Jx3nW

Don't wait until the last minute!  Register to vote in the May 15 Election before 11:59pm on April 24th.  Every person registered to vote by Tuesday the 24th will receive a ballot for the May 15 election.  https://t.co/tPt2XQ17Ol
@Oregonian All registered voters will receive a ballot for the May 15 Election.  This headline is causing confusion with non-affiliated voters thinking they will not receive a ballot.
To find out more about Services for Voters with Disabilities visit https://t.co/ygSDwSWGfz

This is the last weekend to register to vote if you want to vote in the May 15th election.  Every registered voter will receive a ballot for the May 15 election whether they are a member of any political party or not.  Register by April 24 at https://t.co/tPt2XQ17Ol
Need an audio version of the Voters Pamphlet?  Find one here: https://t.co/oZ3xTtRBKc
The online version of the Voters Pamphlet is now available on our website.  Find it here: https://t.co/p6jMtLXakX
2.65 million ballots are being prepared to be mailed to Oregonians starting next week.
Check your mailbox.  Voters pamphlets will begin arriving today.  Delivery dates from @usps are today thru Friday. https://t.co/Iq6PbFgmOd

@jaiPDX Those registered with minor political parties will be able to vote for all non partisan offices at the May 15 election.  Voters pamphlets will arrive at every household in Oregon later this week.  You can see a sample ballot online at https://t.co/TdeN4LQU76
There is only ONE WEEK LEFT to register to vote in the May 15 Primary Election.  April 24th is the deadline.  Check your registration status at https://t.co/TdeN4LQU76 https://t.co/e44VcFCVax
@fro_Oregon Contact your county election official and there will be a way for you to receive a ballot where you are.  Here is contact info: https://t.co/CzA3Kb8O3w
Meeting with our awesome @USPS partners finalizing delivery logistics for voters pamphlets and ballots. #votebymail https://t.co/yDwQlNC0hD

@fro_Oregon You have not missed the deadline to receive a ballot.  Go to https://t.co/TdeN4LQU76 to confirm your address and see when your ballot will be mailed.  If you still have questions contact your county election official.

Did you know the voters pamphlet is mailed to "each post-office mailing address in Oregon?"  It gives everyone the opportunity to know there is an election coming and invites people not registered to vote to register  before the deadline for the election.  https://t.co/leeKQtZXKg

There are 5 weeks until Election Day.  Every household in Oregon will receive a voters pamphlet for the May 15 election between April 18-20.  Every registered voter in Oregon will receive a ballot between April 25 and May 1.

@donnalc No.  Every signature on every ballot envelope is compared against the signature in our voter registration database by a human being.  Some counties scan the signature off the envelope, but they are all reviewed by a human.  A 2nd review takes place for signatures that dont match.

Over 100 Oregon county election officials were trained on signature verification last week by a forensic handwriting expert.  This will help to ensure that there is consistency throughout the state on which ballot envelope signatures are valid and which are not.
1,790 sponsorship signatures for Initiative Petition #44 have been submitted. Signature verification will be completed by April 23rd.  https://t.co/bOouKrv8z6.

There are 8 political parties in Oregon.  3 have met the threshold to be major parties, and 5 are minor parties.  Major parties select nominees through the primary election.  Minor parties choose how to select their nominees according to their party rules. https://t.co/3Qk8TB545I
Voter's Pamphlets for the May 15 Primary Election will arrive in Oregon homes between April 18 and 20.  Our voter guide for military and overseas voters is available here: https://t.co/7CsK8VzrXX

The May 15 Primary Election is six weeks from today.  More importantly, the voter registration deadline to vote in the May Primary is just three weeks away on April 24th. Register online today: https://t.co/tPt2XQ17Ol https://t.co/UiEIVFiITQ

Don't forget that you can register to vote online in any of these languages: English
Español Spanish
中文 Chinese
Tiếng Việt Vietnamese
Soomaali Somali
русский Russian
https://t.co/Y30fA7GaUi
1,185 sponsorship signatures for Initiative Petition #40 have been submitted. Signature verification will be completed by April 12th. https://t.co/wPSkWbj7Aq
@Enstone April 24

full_text: May 15 Primary Election ballots are now being mailed to military and overseas voters.  Because of longer transit times, federal law requires these ballots be mailed at least 45 days before an election.  Here is more info for military and overseas voters: https://t.co/QucxHyGd00
3,443 sponsorship signatures for Initiative Petition #43 have been submitted. Signature verification will be completed by April 9th. https://t.co/TsIROAeQNE

@Indivisible_OR @JasonKander @letamericavote @EricHolder @Oregonian @wweek @busproject We encourage you to share with your contacts that although the online voter registration system will be down this Saturday that they can go to https://t.co/tPt2XQ17Ol right now or anytime between Sunday and April 24th to register for the May 15 Primary.
@Indivisible_OR @JasonKander @letamericavote @EricHolder @Oregonian @wweek @busproject This is a planned power outage by PGE for all of the Capitol Mall.  We had no control over the timing.

There are 54 days until the May 15 Primary Election.  The Independent Party of Oregon has chosen to allow voters who are not a member of a political party to vote in their primary election.  Go here to request an Independent Party of Oregon primary ballot. https://t.co/095prvN5Fd
Eyelets, loops, boats, flags, crossbars, arcade movement, garland movement, connecting strokes.  All things the Elections Division is learning in forensic signature verification training today.
The Military and Overseas Voters' Guide for the May 15 Primary has been posted to our website.  It contains information that will be included in the Voters Pamphlet. https://t.co/05oEVJiSSh

At the close of filing for the May 15 Primary there are 17 candidates for Governor, 3 for BOLI Commissioner, 6 in the 1st Congressional District, 11 in the 2nd CD, 6 in the 3rd CD, 7 in the 4th CD and 5 in the 5th CD.  See all the filings here: https://t.co/yQI26X63XO
Next week is deadline week for the May Primary.  Tuesday the 6th is the candidate filing deadline, and Thursday the 8th is the voters pamphlet filing deadline.  Don't wait until the last minute.
How Secure are Oregon Elections? https://t.co/eNTiR2y153
There is one week left to file to run for office at the May 15 primary election.  The deadline is 5:00pm on March 6 and a list of open offices can be found here: https://t.co/1TlaZgRygp

The January 23rd Special Election has been certified and is now official. 1,065,503 ballots were cast.  The Yes vote prevailed with 657,117 votes compared with 408,386 No votes.  That is 61.67% to 38.33% with turnout of 40.5%.

The Independent Party has notified us they will continue to open their primary election to non-affiliated voters in 2018, pursuant to ORS 254.365(3)(a).  Major political parties must notify us by this Wednesday, 2/14, if they choose to open their primary to non-affiliated voters

The latest results for the Special Election show turnout at 40.21% with 1,059,871 ballots counted.   Yes is at 61.7% and No at 38.3%.  Monday is the deadline for counties to certify their final results to the Secretary of State.
The latest results for the Special Election show turnout has now passed 40% at 40.01%.   Yes is at 61.7% and No at 38.3%

There is just one month left to file to run for office at the May 15 Primary.  March 6 is the filing deadline.  If you are running, check out the Cybersecurity Campaign Playbook created by the @BelferCenter at Harvard on our website here: https://t.co/p6jMtLFyWn
The latest results for the Special Election show turnout at 39.95% with 1,053,060 ballots counted.   Yes is at 61.7% and No at 38.3%
Want to find out which offices are up for election in 2018 and who has already filed to run for them?  Visit https://t.co/p6jMtLFyWn to see.  The filing deadline for the May Primary is March 6th.
The latest results for the Special Election show turnout at 39.83% with 1,049,737 ballots counted.   Yes is at 61.6% and No at 38.4%
If you would like to know which initiatives have been proposed, and which ones are currently being circulated, you can check our database here: https://t.co/zuVxAui3Xh

Did you know that if the signature on your ballot envelope was ruled not to match the signature in the voter registration file that you will be notified by your county election official?  You will then have until 14 days after the election to resolve it with election officials.
Wednesday night update shows turnout at 39.59% with Yes at 61.6% and No at 38.4%
There are less than six weeks left to file to run for office in the May Primary.  The candidate filing deadline is March 6.  Here is a list of open offices: https://t.co/1TlaZgRygp
As of 8:00 this morning turnout stands at 39.5% with 1,041,724 ballots received.  Yes at 61.7% and No at 38.3%  Results will be updated every day for the next 20 days at 6am, noon, and 6pm.
@MrsTolva Counties have 20 days to certify final results to the Secretary of State
As of 9:00 all 36 counties are reporting.  Turnout stands at 32.4%.  Yes is at 60.9% and No at 39.1%.

Election results will be posted at https://t.co/RwkeQKY0Qa shortly after 8:00pm Tuesday.  Results will be updated every 15 minutes until midnight. Then after election day, updates will run at 6 am, 12 pm, and 6 pm each day. https://t.co/pIjn8qs6W2

The shutdown of the federal government will have NO impact on Tuesday's election.  Ballots are still being processed and must be received in a dropbox by 8:00pm on Tuesday.

As of January 1st the age to register to vote was lowered from 17 to 16. Eligible citizens 16 years of age or older may now register to vote.  Individuals who are not yet 18 will not be able to vote and will not be included on any public list until they are 18.
